question: India’s largest ‘charkha’ made of waste plastic inaugurated in which city?
explanation: On the eve of Mahatma Gandhi\'s 150th birth anniversary, India\'s largest \'charkha\' (the 1,650-kg spinning wheel) made of used plastic waste was inaugurated by Union Minister Smriti Irani in Noida. The ‘charkha’ symbolizes Gandhi’s dream of Swadeshi (self sufficing and self reliance). It measures 14 ft × 20 ft × 8ft and is made of 1,250 kg of used plastic. The charkha has been recognized as the largest made of used plastic waste in the country by India Book of Records.
